abstract: Isabelle Falque-Pierrotin, France's top privacy regulator, is at center of attempts to monitor how digital data is transferred out of European Union; her efforts mark latest standoff between Europe and American tech firms; Falque-Pierrotin's role could grow even further if American and European negotiators fail to achieve new data-transferring agreement by Feb 1.
lead_paragraph: Whether or not negotiators reach a pact by Feb. 1 on how companies like Google and Facebook use Europeans’ online data, Isabelle Falque-Pierrotin is in a position to propel privacy protection efforts.

headline.main: Europe’s Top Digital-Privacy Watchdog Zeros In on U.S. Tech Giants

snippet: Whether or not negotiators reach a pact by Feb. 1 on how companies like Google and Facebook use Europeans’ online data, Isabelle Falque-Pierrotin is in a position to propel privacy protection efforts.

keywords.value: Commission Nationale de l'Informatique et des Libertes (CNIL)
keywords.name: organizations
